content.body:
> `({ x: when [y] } = value)` is already legal JS

what. how. what does that parse as
content.formatted_body:
({ x: when [y] } = value) is already legal JS

what. how. what does that parse as

content.body: mfer is that pulling out the x property and assigning its value to `when[y]`
content.formatted_body: mfer is that pulling out the x property and assigning its value to when[y]

content.body: it's super terrible and i don't understand how the 2015 era committee thought it was acceptable, but here we are
clearly we need to swap `when`=>`case` and just call it a day
content.formatted_body: clearly we need to swap when=>case and just call it a day
